creator: roberta_yusba@tesseract.com
text:
When I use the war task in 1.5 or 1.5.1, and then try to open it with WinZip, I 
get the following series of errors:
1) error:  (war file name) missing 4007501 bytes in Zip file (attempting to 
process anyway)
2) then I hit ok and get:
error (war file name) reported length of central directory is 4007501 bytes too 
long (Atari STZip file? J.H. Holm ZIPSPLIT 1.1 Zip file?) Compensating.
3)  Hit OK again and get:  Cannot open file, it does not appear to be a valid 
archive. 

AAT and WAS cannot open it either.  

I have had to use Ant 1.5 for my compiles (since I use the sourcepath 
attribute) and then revert to Ant 1.4 for the ejbjar, war and ear.

HELP!

Thanks,
Roberta

creator: conor@apache.org
text:
Is there any chance you could send me an example of such a zip file and the
build file you used to produce it.

creator: roberta_yusba@tesseract.com
text:
I am emailing the .war file and build.xml to you at 
conor@cortexebusiness.com.au. It's a big attachment and I can't seem to attach 
it to the bug record.  For whatever it's worth, I ran a compare between a good 
war and a bad war and the difference seems to be in the handling of META-INF.  
But why that should make the zip file not open, I don't know.
Thanks so much for your time and expertise.

creator: rvanoo@xs4all.nl
text:
I sort of reproduced this on Ant 1.5.2

My symptoms seem to be slightly different. My build outputs a war file, which 
when I open it with WinZip only appears to contain the stuff I added with a 
fileset. All the <webinf> and <classes> and <lib> stuff appears to be missing, 
even though running -verbose says the task is adding the correct number of 
files to the war. The 'missing' entries do show up when examining the file with 
jar -t

Doesn't seem to be an issue on Linux (using same CVS tree and build script).

I'll attach my war file and the script used to create it.

creator: jakarta@ehatchersolutions.com
text: I had a report that the .zip I built (using <zip>) and pretty close to CVS HEAD of Ant is unreadable in WinZip, but worked fine with Cygwin unzip.  The zip file is here:http://www.ehatchersolutions.com/downloads/JavaDevWithAnt-1.0.zip
just reproduced this on a fresh checkout of the HEAD branch.
creator: rvanoo@xs4all.nl
levylambert@tiscali-dsl.de
text: *** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 17648 ***
